Key Match Events: Rookie Tristan da Silva went off for 25 points and Goga Bitazde chipped in with 11 points and 13 rebounds as the Orlando Magic cruised past the Toronto Raptors 106-97.
The Magic made a season-best 19 threes on 44 attempts.

Jalen Suggs had to be taken off the floor in a wheelchair after he dove to play a ball in the passing lane and hit the floor, grabbing his lower back in obvious pain. He was later declared out with back spasms.
Pre-Game Insights: Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic highlighted the defensive capabilities of the Magic, particularly Jalen Suggs' active hands and the team's overall defensive commitment.
Post-Match Reflections: Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic reflected on the defensive issues, particularly the three-point line, stating, 'We just did not get close enough to shooters that we identified as shooters. We allowed rhythm shots, and they caught fire.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cory Joseph, a former Raptors player, had one of his best games of the season against his old team, finishing with 11 points and three assists.
Caleb Houstan, a Mississauga native, got his first start of the season and performed well, making a pair of threes and playing a sound, smart game in his 24 minutes.
Others: The loss stopped the Raptors winning streak at one and dropped them to 8-27 on the season. The Magic improved to 21-15.
The Magic have developed a culture, infused it with elite talent and surrounded it with quality depth under team president Jeff Weltman.
